results.title: Murder on the orient express
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Based on Agatha Christie’s famous novel, this Sidney Lumet Film has an all star cast. The legendary Belgian detective Hercule Poirot encounters a murder when he is aboard the famous Orient Express. The train is stuck in a snowdrift so the murderer is still on the train and Poirot must sort through a multitude of clues, lies and false trails before the truth can be revealed.
Cast includes: Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Martin Balsam, Ingrid Bergman, Jacqueline Bisset, Sean Connery, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller, Anthony Perkins, Vanessa Redgrave, Richard Widmark and Michael York.

results.title: Evil under the sun
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin, EMI/Parlophone and Titan Film Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Ustinov stars as Agatha Christie’s famed Belgian detective Hercule Poirot in this all-star production of ‘Evil under the sun’. Diana Rigg is bitchy Broadway musical star Arlena Marshall, on holiday with her husband and stepdaughter on an Adriatic island. The hotel is filled with people who have a reason to hate her and when she is found strangled on a beach, Poirot must exercise “his little grey cells” and find the murderer. Excellent costuming, a witty screenplay by Anthony Schaffer and a delightful Cole Porter soundtrack will delight.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Hamilton, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin, EMI/Parlophone and Titan Film Productions

results.title: True romance (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Samuel Hapida, Davis-Films and True Romance Productions
results.brief_description: Clarence (Christian Slater) and Alabama (Patricia Arquette) are two drifting youths, a petty crim and a prostitute, who find each other and swear eternal love. But their happiness is short-lived: very soon they have a coterie of violent sadistic gangsters on their trail. Tony Scott’s thriller is a hip, fast and very violent homage to the action, thriller and noir genres. Scripted by Quentin Tarantino, the film features cameos by Brad Pitt, Gary Oldman, Val Kilmer and a very excellent Dennis Hopper, and is filled with knowing jokes and references to Hollywood, Hong Kong and exploitation cinema. The performances by Slater and Arquette are inspired. Their performances add a dimension of grace and substance to what is a film with a very 90s consciousness: amoral and obsessed by surfaces. A rollercoaster ride of a film - fun but not for the squeamish.

results.title: Flirt
results.creator_credit: Hal Hartley, Ted Hope, Nippon Film Development & Finance, Pandora Films and True Fiction Pictures
results.brief_description: If you’re interested in the art of storytelling, then you’ll enjoy “Flirt”. Hal Hartley takes the same narrative and retells it three times, changing the cultural and gender contexts of each story. Set in America, Berlin, and Tokyo, the same twisted love story unfolds with the same quirky twists and dramatic conclusion. Hartley flirts with the audience as he playfully includes many self-conscious allusions to his role as the ‘storyteller’, even including himself as a player in the final version of the narrative. While “Flirt” may not have the same dramatic intensity of some of Hartley’s other films, it becomes compelling through the differences and similarities revealed with each new unfolding of the narrative.

results.title: A Bronx tale
results.creator_credit: Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, John Kilik and Tribeca Productions
results.brief_description: Calogero Anello is a streetwise nine year old whose father Lorenzo, fights to keep him from being corrupted by the neighbourhood in which they live. The boy witnesses a murder but refuses to identify Sonny, the local crime boss he has long admired, as the perpetrator. Sonny becomes a “surrogate” father to the boy, teaching him to survive in the streets. Over the next eight years, Lorenzo is powerless to stop his son from adopting the dangerous lifestyle of his hero Sonny. Robert De Niro stars and directs this often poignant but tragic motion picture.

results.title: The Bank of England
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Ian Dalrymple and Wessex Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the many aspects of the Bank’s life; the traditions and premises, the hierarchy and staff; meetings of the Court and committees; the work of certain departments such as the printing works. An intricate machine and the people who operate it have been skillfully photographed. Includes the Guard, the Sports Club, and the exterior of several branches. Indirectly the historical aspects are portrayed.

results.title: Rob Roy
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Peter Broughan, Richard Jackson and Talisman
results.brief_description: When a harsh winter threatens the majestic Scottish Highlands, Robert Roy McGregor (Liam Neeson) is forced to borrow money from the not so noble Marquis of Montrose (John Hurt) to provide for his clan. But when Montrose’s evil henchmen (brilliantly portrayed by Tim Roth and Brian Cox) conspire to take the wealth for themselves, they thrust Rob into the most challenging battle of his life, one that escalates into a bloody and gripping climax. Breathtaking landscapes, steamy romance and non-stop action combine to make this a thrilling and powerful adventure.

results.title: Death on the Nile
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A star-studded cast features in this version of a great Agatha Christie classic story. Peter Ustinov stars as the famous Belgian detective Hercule Poirot investigating the murder of rich American heiress Lynette Ridgeway on board a Nile steamer. All the passengers including her newly acquired husband have reason to want her dead and it is Poirot who puts “his little grey cells” to work and solves the mystery. Beautifully costumed, starring Jane Birkin, Lois Chiles, Bette Davis, Mia Farrow, Jon Finch, Olivia Hussey, I.S. Johar, George Kennedy, Angela Lansbury, Simon MacCorkindale, David Niven, Maggie Smith and Jack Warden.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Interview with a vampire: the vampire chronicles (S)
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, David Geffen, Stephen Woolley and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: The first of Anne Rice’s “Vampire Chronicles” was brought to the screen by Neil Jordan. Despite initial public misgivings, Tom Cruise is convincingly seductive and evil as the Vampire Lestat. Brad Pitt plays Louis, the narrator of the strange history of his journey into immortality as a vampire. These two are ably supported by an all star cast including Christian Slater, Antonio Banderas, Kirsten Dunst and Stephen Rea. Jordan’s film is visually striking and sensual; so much so that the viewer is often torn between a world full of blood and horror and the allurement of immortality and the supernatural.
